title: Royal Edinburgh; Her Saints, Kings, Prophets and Poets
author: Oliphant, Mrs. (Margaret)
snippet: One son buried, like any peasant's son, ignobly in the Abbeyof Lindores: the other in an English prison, at the mercy of the "auldenemy," whom Scotland had again and again resisted to the death: and hiskingdom entirely gone from him, in the hands of his arrogant andimperious brother; there was nothing left for poor King Robert but todie.
